00039 inline bool ORDGF4cLiveTimeDecoder::SetDataRecord(UInt_t* record)
00040 { 
00041   fDataRecord = record;
00042   if(fDataRecord == NULL) return false;
00043   fDataRecordLength = LengthOf(fDataRecord);
00044   Int_t length = GetRecordLength();
00045   if(length < 0) length = 0;
00046   if((fDataRecordLength != (UInt_t) length)&&(length > 0))
00047   {
00048     ORLog(kWarning) 
00049       << "Record length from xml header does not match record header" << std::endl
00050       << "xml header: " << length << ", header length: " 
00051       << fDataRecordLength << std::endl;
00052   }
00053   if(fDataRecordLength == 13)
00054   {
00055     ORLog(kWarning) 
00056     << "This data was taken with an outdated version of Orca.  " << std::endl
00057     << "DGF4c run times, live times, and real times have been truncated." << std::endl
00058     << "Live time data record length: " << fDataRecordLength << std::endl;
00059   }else if(fDataRecordLength != 19)
00060   {
00061     ORLog(kWarning) 
00062     << "SetDataRecord(): The length of the live time record is not an expected value: " 
00063     << fDataRecordLength << std::endl;
00064   }
00065   ORLog(kDebug) << "length " << fDataRecordLength << std::endl;
00066   return true;
00067 }
00068 
00069 inline UInt_t ORDGF4cLiveTimeDecoder::CrateOf() //returns crate # of XIA card
00070 { 
00071   return (fDataRecord[2] & 0x01e00000) >> 21; 
00072 }
00073 
00074 inline UInt_t ORDGF4cLiveTimeDecoder::CardOf()
00075 { 
00076   return (fDataRecord[2] & 0x001f0000) >> 16; 
00077 }
00078 
00079 /*
00080   The GetOld* versions of the following functions
00081   are used for data taken with an old version of 
00082   Orca.  
00083 */
00084 
00085 inline Double_t ORDGF4cLiveTimeDecoder::GetRealTime()
00086 { 
00087   return CalculateTime(&fDataRecord[3]);
00088 }
00089 
00090 inline Double_t ORDGF4cLiveTimeDecoder::GetOldRealTime()
00091 { 
00092   return UnpackDouble(fDataRecord[3]);
00093 }
00094 
00095 inline Double_t ORDGF4cLiveTimeDecoder::GetRunTime()
00096 { 
00097   return CalculateTime(&fDataRecord[5]);
00098 }
00099 
00100 inline Double_t ORDGF4cLiveTimeDecoder::GetOldRunTime()
00101 { 
00102   return UnpackDouble(fDataRecord[4]);
00103 }
00104 
00105 inline Double_t ORDGF4cLiveTimeDecoder::GetChanLiveTime(UInt_t channelNum)
00106 {
00107   return CalculateTime(&fDataRecord[7+channelNum*3]);
00108 }
00109 
00110 inline Double_t ORDGF4cLiveTimeDecoder::GetOldChanLiveTime(UInt_t channelNum)
00111 {
00112   return UnpackDouble(fDataRecord[5+2*channelNum]);
00113 }
00114 
00115 inline Double_t ORDGF4cLiveTimeDecoder::CalculateTime(UInt_t* recordPtr)
00116 {
00117   UInt_t a = recordPtr[0];
00118   UInt_t bc = recordPtr[1];
00119   UInt_t c = bc & 0xffff;
00120   UInt_t b = bc >> 16;
00121   // time in seconds:
00122   Double_t time = (a*TMath::Power(65536.0,2.0)+b*65536.0+c)*1.0e-6/40.;
00123   ORLog(kDebug) << "CalculateTime(): a = " << a << ", b = " << b << ", c = " << c<< std::endl;
00124   ORLog(kDebug) << "CalculateTime(): time = " << time << "s" << std::endl;
00125   return time;
00126 }
00127 
00128 
00129 
00130 inline Double_t ORDGF4cLiveTimeDecoder::UnpackDouble(UInt_t record)
00131 {
00132   /*  Orca outputs some numbers in double format, but the second
00133   4 of 8 bytes are lost.  This method reads out the sign, 
00134   exponent, and (truncated) mantissa of the double, and 
00135   returns the value. */   
00136 
00137   UInt_t sign = (record & 0x80000000) >> 31;
00138   UInt_t expMask = 0x7ff00000; 
00139   UInt_t exponent = ((record & expMask) >> 20);
00140   if(exponent > 0) exponent -= 1023;
00141   Double_t mantissa = (Double_t) (record & ~expMask);
00142   if(mantissa > 0) mantissa += 0x100000;
00143   ORLog(kDebug) << "UnpackDouble() "  << std::endl;
00144   return (1-2*sign)*mantissa*TMath::Power(2,exponent-20.0);    
00145 }
00146 
00147 inline UInt_t ORDGF4cLiveTimeDecoder::GetChanNumEvents(UInt_t channelNum)
00148 { 
00149   return fDataRecord[9+3*channelNum];
00150 }
00151 
00152 inline UInt_t ORDGF4cLiveTimeDecoder::GetOldChanNumEvents(UInt_t channelNum)
00153 { 
00154   return fDataRecord[6+2*channelNum];
00155 }
00156 
00157 inline Int_t ORDGF4cLiveTimeDecoder::GetRecordLength()
00158 {
00159   return GetIntValueFromKey("LiveTime:length",CrateOf(),CardOf());
00160 }
